text:
Tanjong Pagar MRT Station (EW15) is a bustling station on Singapore’s East-West Line, situated in the heart of the Central Business District (CBD). It is conveniently located near key commercial hubs, including the Microsoft Singapore office and several other corporate buildings.

The station features clear signage, multiple exits, and easy connectivity to nearby offices, hotels, and dining options. It’s a popular choice for professionals and visitors alike. Just a short walk away, you’ll find amenities like Tanjong Pagar Plaza and a variety of cafes and restaurants that cater to the busy office crowd.

With its central location and excellent accessibility, Tanjong Pagar MRT Station is a key transit point for both locals and tourists exploring the CBD.

In my opinion, this is a very well planned MRT station. I have captured astonishing pictures when it was nearly empty and less crowded.
There is a great connectivity of East West line and also you will be able to find a significant amount of Korean, Japanese, and Chinese restaurants nearby.
Also, the Chinatown marketplace is walkable from this MRT station.
Nearby tall buildings make this MRT station more lavish.

One of the largest MRT station in Singapore, which is busiest during peak hours due to its central location near. There are numerous shops that provide food and services to the office workers that go through this station, but there is also a famous food street not far from this station.
Lots of convenience store. Atmosphere feels like London Underground Station. Ladies toilet cleanliness can be improved.

One of Singapore's older MRT stations, conveniently located near the city centre. Extremely clean as usual.

Less than 10 mins walk from the Korean BBQ restaurants & heritage shophouses at Tanjong Pagar Road, and also around the same distance from affordable local hawker food at Amoy Street Food Centre.
